data.enText: having or showing a lot of knowledge about a particular subject or situation

data.chText: 有依据的选择 / 决定 / 猜测 / 看法
他们不完全了解这些改变。
data.enText: They are not fully informed about the changes.
Keep me informed of any developments.

value.def: Someone who is informed knows about a subject or what is happening in the world.

example.ex: Informed people know the company is shaky.
example.tran: 了解情况的人知道该公司状况不佳。

example.ex: ...the importance of keeping the public properly informed.
example.tran: 使公众适当知情的重要性

value.tran: 有知识的;了解情况的;见多识广的

value.def: When journalists talk about informed sources, they mean people who are likely to give correct information because of their private or special knowledge.

example.ex: According to informed sources, those taken into custody include at least one major-general.
example.tran: 据可靠消息,那些被拘捕者当中至少有一位少将。

value.def: An informed guess or decision is one that likely to be good, because it is based on definite knowledge or information.

example.ex: An informed guess at his personal wealth was $1.25 billion...
example.tran: 据合理猜测，他的个人财产有 12.5 亿美元。

example.ex: We are able to make more informed choices about how we use drugs.
example.tran: 我们能够更加明智地选择如何使用药物。

value.tran: (猜测或决策)明智的,有见识的
